content: In Greek mythology, the god of art and images is often referred to as Hermes, who is the messenger of the gods and the god of commerce, art, and theft. He is often depicted carrying a staff with two intertwined snakes, known as the caduceus, which is a symbol of his role as a messenger and guide. Another god associated with art and images is Apollo, who is the god of the sun, music, poetry, and prophecy. He is often depicted playing a lyre, which is a stringed musical instrument, and is considered to be the patron of the arts.
